Izginila tudi partnerka 75-letnega pokojnika
05 Nov 2019, 09:29 by Spletno uredništvo

Šele rezultati obdukcije, ki jih pričakujejo v prihodnjih dneh, naj bi pokazali, kaj se je dejansko zgodilo v stanovanju v tretjem nadstropju poslopja podjetja za ljudske gradnje Ater v Ul. del Veltro 45, kjer so 2. novembra zvečer našli mrtvega 75-letnega L. F..



Šele rezultati obdukcije, ki jih pričakujejo v prihodnjih dneh, naj bi pokazali, kaj se je dejansko zgodilo v stanovanju v tretjem nadstropju poslopja podjetja za ljudske gradnje Ater v Ul. del Veltro 45. Foto: Vir:Primorski dnevnik/FotoDamjan

TRST > Po pisanju Primorskega dnevnika so preiskovalci sicer precej previdni glede tega, ali je pri smrti 75-letnika, ki so ga našli zavitega v najlonski vreči, šlo dejansko za umor ali kaj drugega. Smrt je namreč po ugotovitvah preiskovalcev nastopila pred dvema ali tremi tedni, dodali pa so samo še to, da so truplo pokojnika našli v dveh plastičnih vrečah: ena je ovijala trup, druga pa glavo. Tožilstvo je prepričano, da je šlo za uboj na krut način (75-letnik je imel ureznine na vratu) in po pisanju časnika zagotavlja hitro rešitev primera.
Do grozljivega odkritja je prišlo v soboto zvečer, ko so okoli 19.40 v Ul. del Veltro, ki so jo zaprli za promet, prišli pripadniki državne policije, gasilci in forenziki, potem ko so jih poklicali sosedje, ki 75-letnega soseda že dalj časa niso videli. Ko so s pomočjo gasilcev stopili v stanovanje, jih je pričakal grozljiv prizor: truplo 75-letnika je bilo, kot omenjeno, v najlonskih vrečah in po znakih razpadanja preiskovalci sklepajo, da je bilo tam že dva ali tri tedne. Na truplu so našli znake, ki bi lahko kazali na to, da je pokojnik umrl nasilne smrti. V stanovanju, ki naj bi bilo urejeno in počiščeno, ni bilo nikogar.
L. F. je že več let živel s 65-letno ukrajinsko državljanko O. L., ki pa je po pisanju Primorskega dnevnika že več tednov ni na spregled, odkar so nekateri sosedje iz njunega stanovanja slišali kričanje in klice na pomoč. Vendar, kot pravi ena od sosed, se je 75-letnika pred tem slišalo kričati že večkrat. Po njenih besedah naj bi bil L. F. precej živčen, menda zaradi nesreče, ki jo je doživel pred leti. Zato, ko so ga zadnjič slišali kričati, se verjetno sosedi niso preveč menili za to, še dodaja časnik.

The partner of the 75-year-old deceased also disappeared
05 Nov 2019, 09:29 by Web Editing

Only the autopsy results, which they expect in the coming days, are expected to show what actually happened in the apartment on the third floor of the Ater Public Works company building in Ul. del Veltro 45, where they found dead 75-year-old L. F. on the evening of November 2.



Only the autopsy results, which they expect in the coming days, are expected to show what actually happened in the apartment on the third floor of the Ater Public Works company building in Ul. del Veltro 45. Photo: Source: Primorski dnevnik / PhotoDamjan

TRIESTE> According to Primorski Dnevnik, investigators are quite cautious about whether the death of the 75-year-old, who was found wrapped in a nylon bag, was actually a homicide or something. According to investigators, the death occurred two or three weeks ago, but they only added that the dead body of the deceased was found in two plastic bags: one wrapped around the torso and the other wrapped around the head. The prosecution is convinced it was a brutal murder (the 75-year-old had a cut in his neck) and, according to the newspaper, provides a quick solution to the case.
The horrifying discovery came on Saturday night when around 7.40pm on Ul. The part of the Veltro that was closed to traffic came from state police, firefighters and forensics after being called by neighbors who had not seen the 75-year-old neighbor for a long time. When they arrived at the apartment with the help of firefighters, a horrific scene awaited them: the body of the 75-year-old was found in nylon bags and, according to signs of decay, investigators concluded that it had been there for two or three weeks. Signs were found on the corpse that could indicate that the deceased had died a violent death. There was no one in the apartment that was supposed to be tidy and clean.
L. F. lived for many years with a 65-year-old Ukrainian citizen, O. L., who has been out of sight for weeks, according to Primorski Dnevnik, since some neighbors from their apartment heard shouting and calls for help. However, according to one neighbor, the 75-year-old has been heard shouting several times before. According to her, L. F. should be quite nervous, apparently because of an accident he experienced years ago. That's why the last time they heard him scream, the neighbors probably didn't think too much about it, the newspaper added.
